thread.title: Take a peek at the Children's Book Week poster
thread.title_full: Take a peek at the Children's Book Week poster

author: USA TODAY
title: Take a peek at the Children's Book Week poster
text:
Take a peek at the Children's Book Week poster Kids' illustrator Christian Robinson gets the assignment this year. Post to Facebook Take a peek at the Children's Book Week poster Kids' illustrator Christian Robinson gets the assignment this year.  //usat.ly/2jCj8Wi   Take a peek at the Children's Book Week poster Jocelyn McClurg , USA TODAY 6:05 a.m. ET Jan. 19, 2017 The 2017 poster for Children's Book Week. (Photo: Children's Book Week) 42 CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Can a poster unite a world of young readers? 
Why not? Here’s a first look at this year’s poster for Children’s Book Week, the annual celebration of books for kids and teens, which this year runs from May 1-7. 
The new poster is the handiwork of children’s book illustrator Christian Robinson, and it sports the week’s official slogan: “One World, Many Stories,” to highlight the power of books to unite readers of all backgrounds. 
Christian Robinson designed this year's poster. (Photo: Christian Robinson) 
Robinson has illustrated such picture books as Gaston by Kelly DiPucchio and the Newbery Award-winning Last Stop on Market Street by Matt de la Peña. 
This will be the 98th annual celebration commemorating books for young people and the joy of reading. Events include appearances by children's authors, read-alouds and book parties. 
Those who attend receive Children's Book Week posters. Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2jCj8Wi NEVER MISS OUT Life Be a pop culture maven. Get the news, reviews and the juiciest celebrity stories that keep you in the know, Monday-Friday. THANKS FOR SIGNING UP FOR THE Life NEWSLETTER 
We're sorry.
